job_title: Director, Data Analytics at Banner Health in Phoenix, AZ
job_description:
CORE FUNCTIONS 1. Compiles Revenue Cycle data, creates enterprise, regional, and local metric dashboard(s) from start to finish (full stack development) and conducts advanced revenue cycle operational performance analysis to provide a high level of financial and operational expertise through analysis and interpretation of data. Gathers and challenges assumptions from various multi-disciplinary teams and data sources. 2. Serves as leader or subject matter expert in Revenue Cycle data, which includes the initiation and assistance in identification and implementation of operating improvements and efficiencies by identifying important trends and variances. 3. Manages data and integrity to include ongoing validation and comparison with Revenue Cycle operational activity. Aligns data communication with key stakeholders to ensure consistent data share and interpretation. 4. Provides direction to manage implementation and support for Revenue Cycle information systems to enhance current and future system functionality. 5. Responsible for Intermediate to Advanced level queries in SQL or similar language AND ability to work with advanced data visualizations AND the ability to conduct advanced revenue cycle operational performance analysis. 6. Acts as the project lead for Revenue Cycle Analytics implementation and systems to enhance current and future system functionality. Manages and maintains the training program, schedule, and deployment to Revenue Cycle Analytics team members. 7. Manages day to day relationship with Revenue Cycle and other operational areas Directors and leaders to manage and maintain standardized metrics and data integrity management across the enterprise. 8. Manages all Revenue Cycle Analytics platforms, systems, interfaces and exchanges. 9. Works on complex problems in which analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various factors. Proven advanced analytical and modeling skills are necessary. Must be able to work with minimal supervision and prioritize multiple projects and use of sophisticated software programs. Exercise judgment within generally defined practices and policies in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions. Position interacts with all levels of hospital and system leadership and staff, physicians, regulatory agencies, and vendors. Performs all functions according to established policies, procedures, regulatory and accreditation requirements, as well as applicable professional standards. Provides all customers of Banner Health with an excellent service experience by consistently demonstrating our core and leader behaviors each and every day. NOTE:
The core functions are intended to describe the general content of and requirements of this position and are not intended to be an exhaustive statement of duties. Specific tasks or responsibilities will be documented as outlined by the incumbent's immediate manager. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Must possess strong knowledge of business, finance, health management, statistics, engineering and/or analytics as normally obtained through the completion of a bachelor's degree. Must possess seven plus years of current and progressive experience of analysis work in healthcare or an equivalent combination of relevant education, technical, business and related industry experience. At least two years of management leadership experience required. Must be proficient in the use of sophisticated software programs. Proven advanced, analytical and modeling skills are necessary. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Knowledge of statistical analysis is preferred. MBA preferred. Additional related education and/or experience preferred.
Salary Range:
$80K -- $150K
Minimum Qualification
Data Science & Machine Learning, Business Intelligence & Analytics, Technology ManagementEstimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications.
